intro: Eriogonum nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Eriogonum nelsonii is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe and mountainous regions.
